Dear Mr. Porter:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
(date). Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. It should be
noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also violations of the MSA
and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter
and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MSA citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular license license will be
issued. If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action will
result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (517) 284-9720.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R 400.155 Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care
institutions;
initial treatment plan.
(1) The social service worker shall complete, sign, and date
an initial
treatment plan for each resident within 30 calendar days of
admission.
Three residential files were reviewed. One out of three files did
not have an initial treatment plan completed within 30 calendar
days of admission. The initial treatment plan was due on
1/18/20 and it was completed on 1/19/20.
R 400.4113 Employee records.
An institution shall maintain employee records for each
employee and
shall include documentation of all of the following
information prior to employment or at the time specified in
this rule:
(i) Documentation from the Michigan department of
human services, the equivalent state or Canadian
provincial agency, or equivalent agency in the
country where the person usually resides, that the
person has not been determined to be a
perpetrator of child abuse or child neglect. The
documentation shall be completed not more than
30 days prior to the start of employment and every
12 months thereafter.
Nine new employee records were reviewed. Two out of nine
records did not have documentation reporting the employee had
not been determined to be a perpetrator of child abuse or child
neglect prior to the start of employment. Both employees were
hired on 10/7/19 and both had central registry clearances dated
10/15/19.
4

R 400.4156 Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care
institutions;
updated treatment plan.
(1) The social service worker shall complete, sign, and date
an updated
treatment plan for each resident at least once every 90-
calendar days following the initial treatment plan.
Three residential files were reviewed. One out of three files did
not have an updated treatment plan completed within 90
calendar days. The report was due on 3/12/20 and it was
completed on 3/13/20.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a MISEP violation. Please note that there are
additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility is in
compliance with all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a MDHHS Contract/Policy violation. Please
note that there are additional MDHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance with all additional MDHHS
Contract/Policy requirements.
4.) I reviewed the PREA Inspection report dated 6/30/20 and the CAP dated 6/19/20.
These documents were provided by PREA.

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.

licensing period.

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or ISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon receipt of an
acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility will be issued a
renewal of their regular license.
